meanings.definition: To travel by getting free rides in passing vehicles.
meanings.sent1: She hitchhikes to school every morning.
meanings.sent2: He often hitchhikes when he goes camping in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The cat hitchhikes on the back of the dog when they play in the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter hitchhikes through the room, spreading joy to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The wind hitchhikes on the leaves, rustling them gently.

meanings.definition: To solicit or request a ride from passing vehicles.
meanings.sent1: They hitchhike to the beach on weekends.
meanings.sent2: People used to hitchhike more frequently before ridesharing apps became popular.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hitchhikes on the passing cars, hoping for a lift to the park.
meanings.sent4: His smile hitchhikes on his face, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The melody hitchhikes on the notes, creating a beautiful harmony.
